intro: Thapsia garganica var. messanensis, commonly known as the Messina thapsia, is a rare and endemic plant native to southern Italy. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in calcareous soils and is found in coastal and mountainous regions. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
